alert.note: Alert for Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Lancaster; Mathews; Middlesex; Northumberland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 4:55PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Gloucester, Middlesex, southeastern King and Queen, southeastern Northumberland, Mathews and Lancaster Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 454 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kilmarnock, moving south at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy downpours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mathews, Kilmarnock, Urbanna, Deltaville, Lancaster, White Stone, Saluda, Gwynn, Hartfield, Glenns, Blakes, Byrdton, Moon, Laban, Brook Vale, Bertrand, Grafton, Amburg, Millenbeck and Greys Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for eastern and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Lancaster; Mathews; Middlesex; Northumberland
